image.altText: Firefights walk past fire damage and smashed glass at the Synagogue.

props.synopsis: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has tried to link a Melbourne synagogue firebombing to Australia's UN vote earlier this week.

title.children: Israel PM links Melbourne synagogue firebombing to Australia's UN vote

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.Â

props.synopsis: It is one thing to take issue with the federal government's position on a resolution to the UN but another to argue it has caused rising anti-Semitic attacks in Australia.

title.children: Middle East politics not the forum for domestic political point scoring

image.altText: A man in a hoodie smiles in cctv footage

props.synopsis: Police say the motive for Brian Thompson's killing is unknown. But it has highlighted threats to those who run America's health insurers, and sparked a conversation about widespread anger at the industry.

title.children: New York shooting highlights anger, and danger, faced by American insurers

image.altText: Two men stand on a beach, the sun peeking through clouds behind them, decaying wreckage in foreground

props.synopsis: How do millions of dollars worth of diamonds go missing on a beach? Most Australians have never heard of the Dakota diamonds mystery, but the drama is still unfolding on the remote north-west coast.

title.children: WWII plane shot down on remote WA beach took stash of diamonds with it

image.altText: Dark storms gather over Kerang, Victoria

props.synopsis: Australia is collectively sweating through an unusually muggy start to summer.

title.children: Warmest waters on Earth help fuel weekend storms for south-east states

image.altText: An aerial view shows a block of houses, many of which have solar panels on top

props.synopsis: The Australian Energy Market Operator has announced a proposal for "emergency backstop" measures to turn down, or switch off, rooftop solar to stabilise the energy grid. This is what it means for households.

title.children: Worth investing in solar? The answer reflects a changing electricity grid

image.altText: A woman washes green leaves in a bucket

props.synopsis: Kratom has been used for centuries as a traditional medicine in South-East Asia, but as its popularity has soared in the United States, so too has the controversy around it.Â

title.children: Traditional Thai medicine hailed as wonder drug in US comes with risks

image.altText: Mitchell Starc holds the ball up towards the crowd as he leaves the field

props.synopsis: Nobody can control the pink ball like Mitchell Starc, but his career-best performance on day one in Adelaide was more than just speed and swing â and has put Australia in a dominant position.

title.children: Starc's pink ball mastery hands Australia a chance to control its destiny

image.altText: Two women sit on an old piece of concrete.

props.synopsis: In 1968, a young Aboriginal woman was jailed for manslaughter when her baby died. It shone a light on the terrible living conditions of Indigenous people in this outback town.

title.children: Sisters mull mum's 1968 imprisonment that sparked national outcry

image.altText: A lit up sign for TikTok on the side of a building in the US.

props.synopsis: The social media giant has been pushing back on the laws, signed by President Joe Biden earlier this year.

title.children: Court upholds US law forcing sale or ban of Tiktok

image.altText: An Islamist militant in camouflage gear and wielding an assault gun stands in the middle of a Syrian street.

props.synopsis: Islamist fighters were approaching a major Syrian city on Friday as part of a rapid offensive, while Kurdish fighters began seizing territory in the country's east.

title.children: Rebels reach Homs as UN says 370,000 people displaced by Syrian war

image.altText: A generic image of compounded semaglutide in a small bottle, with a pharmacy label and red liquid, next to a syringe.

props.synopsis: Weight-loss drugs like Ozempic are transforming the fight against obesity, but they are forcing us to face crucial questions about equity and whether they should be prescribed to children.

title.children: Doctors weigh societal costs of using drugs to treat obesity crisis

image.altText: elon musk stands at a lectern with his mouth open and fists in the air

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump prepares to return to the White House, Elon Musk and Tesla look likely to benefit from influential ties to both the US president and the Chinese government.

title.children: Elon Musk set to be go-between between Trump and China

image.altText: A supermarket shelf has limited stock on it and lots of empty space.

props.synopsis: Woolworths has won its bid against the United Workers Union, with the Fair Work Commission finding the union has been unfairly negotiating with the supermarket giant.

title.children: Fair Work Commission finds union unfairly negotiating with Woolworths

image.altText: two police officers walking down a deserted street from behind

props.synopsis: Calls made by prominent public officials for the riot squad and a federal takeover of the Northern Territory are contained in a list of "sensitivities" about the Alice Springs youth curfew.

title.children: Federal response to Alice Springs curfew obtained under FOI laws

image.altText: A man (Bill Chalker) sits at a desk examining the RAAF's ufo files

props.synopsis: Bill Chalker was one of the first civilians to access Australia's secret UFO files â but when the day finally came, there was one problem. They hadn't been declassified.

title.children: UFOs over Australia and the military's 'very real-world' concerns

image.altText: A cold glass of iced long black sits on a white bench top.

props.synopsis: With summer upon us and the potential for more extreme heatwaves, what's the best way to stay hydrated? And do cold drinks really cool us down?

title.children: Will a cup of tea quench your thirst or make you more dehydrated?

image.altText: A rocket boosting above the ocean.

props.synopsis: The sixth test flight by Elon Musk's space company didn't go exactly to plan, but commentators say there are lessons to be learnt from the work of Pilbara salvage crews.

title.children: Remnants of Musk's SpaceX rocket salvaged off WA's Ningaloo coast

image.altText: A woman with curly hair and a yellow and black check top listens to music through red headphones in a restaurant

props.synopsis: I'm in the same agony of embarrassment and attempted recovery as most of my social media-addicted generation, as my Spotify Wrapped for the year has dropped â and I don't know who the hell they are talking about.

title.children: Between Goblincore and Taylor Swift, I'm baffled by my Spotify Wrapped

image.altText: An andromorphic chimpanzee is surrounded by paparazzi

props.synopsis: The 2025 AACTA award nominations contain record breakers in both the film and television categories.

title.children: Boy Swallows Universe and Robbie Williams biopic lead 2025 AACTAs

image.altText: Richard Nixon and Gerald Ford chat in the Oval Office as they go over papers

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has reneged on his promise not to pardon his son over federal gun felonies and tax crimes. His eleventh-hour decision isn't the first controversial use of presidential clemency powers in US history. Â

title.children: Biden's pardon reflects controversy that dogs US presidential clemency

image.altText: St John paramedics face high levels of violence in comparison to other states and territories.

props.synopsis: Frontline workers at the Northern Territory's troubled private ambulance service are calling for a government overhaul of St John NT following a damning report into its governance and culture.

title.children: NT paramedics fear 'failing their patients' due to poor governance

image.altText: A man in a grey suit poses with his chin in his hand

props.synopsis: The Constitutional Court's unprecedented decision came after Romania's president declassified intelligence that alleged Russia ran a coordinated social media campaign to promote a far-right outsider.

title.children: Romanian court annuls election votes after Russian interference fears

image.altText: An AFP image showing with Anthony Sitar is expected to look like now

props.synopsis: The extradition of Easey street accused Perry Kouroumblis has highlighted other Australians on Interpol's "red notice" list, including Anthony Sitar.

title.children: He's one of Australia's most wanted men and on Interpol's radar

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for the leaders of Israel and Hamas. But international justice works differently to other forms of justice â it requires countries opting in. Will they ever have their day in court?

title.children: If You're Listening explores the courts and war crimes allegations

image.altText: Nic

props.synopsis: The incidence of strokes in young people is rising globally, but finding a village can be a challenge, writes survivor Nicola Bray.

title.children: Nicola a month shy of 18th birthday when part of her brain 'exploded'

image.altText: A woman sits on a hospital bed, holding a baby boy in her arms.

props.synopsis: Just weeks before his first birthday, Kirsty Bryant's son Henry was bitten by a deadly funnel-web spider inside their northern NSW home. Not long after, he stopped breathing.

title.children: Uterus transplant recipient's 'miracle baby' survives funnel-web spider bite

image.altText: A man stares at a beetle

props.synopsis: With the press of a button, researcher Than Vo-Doan can make a beetle walk up, down, left, right, and climb walls like a video game character.

title.children: Scientists can now control bugs like 'cyborgs' and mammals may be next

image.altText: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol delivers a speech at a lectern

props.synopsis: South Korea's National Assembly Speaker Woo Won-shik tells parliament that he and other politicians will fight to prevent martial law if President Yoon Suk Yeol declares it again.

title.children: South Korea's speaker vows no repeat of martial law measure

image.altText: Sydney to Hobart race lead up

props.synopsis: A man believed to be in his 50s who was found with severe chest injuries is dead following the incident at Darling Point.

title.children: Man dies after two boats collide on Sydney Harbour

image.altText: A pile of Australian money, in both coins and notes.

props.synopsis: Steve Minnikin vows to keep cash as a payment method for government services as the new LNP administration launches a new customer services department.

title.children: Queensland's new customer services minister vows to keep cash payments

image.altText: Man with hiking gear smiles and points back/upwards at a mountain full of snow with ski tracks

props.synopsis: The men, from the US and Canada, had been missing for five days and are believed to have died in a fall on Aoraki.Â

title.children: Three climbers believed dead on New Zealand's highest peak

image.altText: A man standing in the burnt remains of a house

props.synopsis: A disability pensioner left homeless by an e-scooter fire issues a desperate warning, as data reveals lithium-ion batteries have been responsible for hundreds of blazes across Queensland.Â

title.children: Pensioner who lost home in e-scooter fire says batteries a 'ticking time bomb'

image.altText: Maggie Tabberer smiles at a red carpet event.

props.synopsis: Maggie Tabberer's career included everything from modelling work to running a fashion label, hosting a TV show and gracing front pages of magazines until her 80s, making her a household name.Â

title.children: Gold Logies and criminally good photo shoots: These were Maggie Tabberer's best moments
